meanings.definition: The amount that a pan can hold.
meanings.sent1: She poured a panful of water into the pot.
meanings.sent2: The chef measured a panful of flour for the recipe.
meanings.sent3: The little girl pretended to cook with a panful of imaginary soup.
meanings.sent4: His heart was a panful of emotions, ready to spill over.
meanings.sent5: The treasure chest was filled with a panful of gold coins.

meanings.sent1: The delicious stew was a panful of warmth on a cold day.
meanings.sent2: She carefully stirred the panful of pasta sauce on the stove.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat licked the panful of leftover gravy when no one was looking.
meanings.sent4: The room was filled with the aroma of a panful of freshly baked bread.
meanings.sent5: The chef proudly presented a panful of colorful roasted vegetables.
